result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Tony Nolan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees, and surcharges by 11/16/15 or civil judgment. Appeal rights given.
Concurrent with: To any other sentence. Time served disposition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Tony Nolan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: signed and filed, Order DENYING defendant's request to extend the time to pay fine, costs and surcharges.
Decision and Order Denying Request to Vacate DNA Surcharge, signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michelle Ackerman Havas, Br. 45, for review. mag
Defendant's request to vacate DNA surcharge and for payment plan.
ADMINISTRATIVE STAY ALLOWING DEFENDANT UNTIL  12-16-2015        TO PAY FINE AND COSTS, GRANTED.

Defendant Anthony Tony Nolan in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Anthony Tony Nolan in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court sentences defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges by 11-16-2015 or civil judgment.
Appeal rights given. 

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Anthony Tony Nolan not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Anthony Tony Nolan in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  
Defendant Anthony Tony Nolan in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
